label.value: Call to Arms: Herald of Victory
Call to Arms: Herald of Victory
Call to Arms: Herald of Victory
Call to Arms: Herald of Victory
Call to Arms: Herald of War
Call to Arms: Herald of War
Call to Arms: Herald of War
Call to Arms: Herald of War
Call to Arms: Herald of Hope
Call to Arms: Herald of Hope
Call to Arms: Herald of Hope
Call to Arms: Herald of Hope
Rain of Arrows: Light From The Sky
Call to Arms: Improved Herald of Victory
Call to Arms: Improved Herald of War
Call to Arms: Improved Herald of Hope
This skill is a fast version of stealth.
After using your Double-edged Strike, you can make a pair of powerful attack against your target.
After using your Double-edged Strike, you make an attack which inflicts high damage, with a chance of creating a 6s opportunity to use Fellowship skills if you are in a Fellowship.
The ground shakes as if the Ents themselves were marching to war causing damage and stunning your enemies.
You are a friend of the Eagles and may now summon one to aid you.
This skill deals damage to some of the enemies and returns that as morale to the Eagle.
This skill will cause the Eagle to bring his master back from the brink of defeat. This skill only functions if the Eagle is in combat.
This skill takes advantage of an enemy who is under Burning Embers and hurts them grievously by stirring up the flames causing them to run in panic.
You fire with the skill of Bard himself, driving fear into evil enemies.
When the need is high, you can move on with little rest, restoring all Power and Morale in only a few seconds.
You rain thorn arrows down upon your enemies, allowing you to pin multiple targets.
The ways of the elder age are not lost to all races yet, you may bring new inspiration to those whose Morale has been entirely depleted, reviving a defeated target in combat.
This song enables you to temporarily reduce the Dread of an area for a short time.
Anthem: Call upon a powerful song to blast your enemies with an area-of-effect of light that will slow the creatures who are hit by it. Requires a recent Tier 3 ballad and resets your ballad counter.
You are able to revive and protect a fallen companion with three quarters of their Morale and half of their Power.
You are able to afford protection to one of your companions, but at the cost of half your Power.
You levy a curse upon your foe which greatly increases the damage your companions can do to it.
Your very presence inspires those around you to perform better in combat.
You make an aggressive triple attack that engenders threat. This attack can only be evaded, it will never miss, and cannot be parried or blocked.
You make an aggressive triple attack that engenders threat. This attack can only be evaded, it will never miss, and cannot be parried or blocked.
A cry of defiance that robs the monsters of some of their Power and gives it to you.
You make a full area-of-effect attack, inflicting heavy damage, drawing the enemies' attention to yourself. This attack never misses.
You make a full area-of-effect attack, inflicting heavy damage, drawing the enemies' attention to yourself. This attack never misses.

Your damage and Power regeneration are increased. This skill can only be executed during combat when you have greater than 20% Morale. It can only be maintained if your Morale does not drop below 20%.
You are able to make a powerful attack against an enemy who has suffered from Overwhelm or Thrust, potentially knocking it down.
After a successful Bash or Shield-taunt, you may bash him again with your shield for greater damage. This skill draws the enemy's attention to yourself.
You focus yourself on enraging your enemies.
You know how to goad your enemies into attacking you, leaving your allies free to maneuver, as well as raising your Guardian's Ward.

Your Herald has a chance to stun the target with a melee attack if it is under the affect of one of your Marks. Additionally, your Herald will do 50% more damage if he is behind the target. This skill has a 60 second cooldown. You must first Mark your opponent before this skill can be used.

Your Herald will taunt the target with a melee attack if it is under the affect of one of your Marks. This skill has a 15 second cooldown. You must first Mark your opponent before this skill can be used.
Your Herald encourages you in times of battle, raising your morale at the cost of his own. This skill has a 90 second cooldown.
You enlist a Herald to carry your Banner of Victory into battle. This banner increases the maximum Power and in-combat Power regeneration of those around it.
You enlist a Herald to carry your Banner of Victory into battle. This banner increases the maximum Power and in-combat Power regeneration of those around it.
You enlist a Herald to carry your Banner of Victory into battle. This banner increases the maximum Power and in-combat Power regeneration of those around it.
You enlist a Herald to carry your Banner of Victory into battle. This banner increases the maximum Power and in-combat Power regeneration of those around it.
You are able to revive a fallen companion with half of their Morale and a quarter of their Power.
When an enemy is defeated, your Cry rallies the Morale of your nearby fellows.
When an enemy is defeated, you let out a Cry which rallies your nearby fellows to attack with greater speed and determination.
When an enemy is defeated, you let out a fearsome Cry which slightly demoralizes all other foes nearby.
Your fearsome Shout strikes terror into the hearts of your enemies and puts you into a Battle-readied State.
Your fearsome Shout strikes terror into the hearts of your enemies and puts you into a Battle-readied State.
You attack defensively. On a successful strike you cause light damage, but recover quickly to protect yourself from returned attacks.
You enlist a Herald to carry your Banner of War into battle. This banner increases the Might and Agility of those around it.
You enlist a Herald to carry your Banner of War into battle. This banner increases the might and agility of those around it.
You enlist a Herald to carry your Banner of War into battle. This banner increases the might and agility of those around it.
You enlist a Herald to carry your Banner of War into battle. This banner increases the might and agility of those around it.
You are able to renew the courage of your nearby companions, removing all existing fear effects from them.
You enlist a Herald to carry your Banner of Hope into battle. This banner increases the maximum Morale and in-combat Morale regeneration of those around it.
You enlist a Herald to carry your Banner of Hope into battle. This banner increases the maximum Morale and in-combat Morale regeneration of those around it.
You enlist a Herald to carry your Banner of Hope into battle. This banner increases the maximum Morale and in-combat Morale regeneration of those around it.
You enlist a Herald to carry your Banner of Hope into battle. This banner increases the maximum Morale and in-combat Morale regeneration of those around it.

If you land a Critical Hit, this attack will deal devastating bonus damage and allow the usage of enemy defeat skills, as well as allowing you to enter into the Battle-hardened state. You must be in a Battle-readied State to use this skill.
Your Shout threatens your enemy, increasing the chance that it will attack you.
Your Shout threatens your enemy, increasing the chance that it will attack you.
You make a swift melee attack.
Half of your Power is transferred to Morale.
A quick attack that will lightly wound your opponent.
After successfully blocking an enemy's blow, you may attack with both your weapon and shield. This skill draws the enemy's attention to yourself.
Your great skill enables you to strengthen your defences for a short time.
You strike your opponent with your shield. This skill generates additional threat.
You catch your breath after blocking an enemy's attack, restoring Morale
You are capable of drawing an enemy's attention to yourself with this attack.
You are capable of drawing an enemy's attention to yourself with this attack.
You know how to goad your enemies into attacking you, leaving your allies free to maneuver.
When wielding a shield, you may protect one of your allies, improving his defence and allowing you to react to attacks made against him.
When wielding a shield, you may protect one of your allies, improving his defence and allowing you to react to attacks made against him.
Your great skill enables you to strengthen your defences for a short time.
You gather your wits and instantly recover some of your skills.
You have the ability to improve your Morale for a time, even above its normal maximum.
The thrill of danger allows you to regain Power, increasing with every enemy near you. This skill works in combat only.
The thrill of danger allows you to regain Power, increasing with every enemy near you. This skill opens up other skills for use. This skill works in combat only.
Your survival skills enable you to lay traps for enemies which can hold them in place. The trap remains for 60 seconds after being placed. This skill is easily interrupted.
In a desperate time, you can instantly reach full Focus.
Your survival-skills allow you to make yourself appear less threatening to enemies for a short time.
You can sacrifice some of your Focus to make ranged attacks at a faster rate.
With a mighty blow, you raise your weapon to fell your enemy.
With a mighty blow, you raise your weapon to fell your enemy with a chance of stunning. When used on a flanked enemy, this ability does even greater damage.
You steal the Power of your enemy, slowly increasing your own.
You steal the Power of your enemy, slowly increasing your own.
Transfers Morale to an ally or companion.
This sign wards your animal friend so that it may parry enemy attacks more frequently and resists damage more effectively. You cannot have more than one sign active on your companion at a time.
You are able to remove wounds suffered by an ally.
You are able to remove wounds in an area-of-effect. This can be used in combat.
This sign asks your animal friend to go into a rage, attacking faster and making itself look as threatening as possible. You cannot have more than one sign active on your companion at a time.
The ground cracks beneath the enemy's feet, inflicting damage and after ten seconds the great upheavels in Arda, roots the target.
Your knowledge of the White Council gives your Morale a boost in times of need. For a short time, it will also protect you and damage enemies who strike you.
A blinding flash accompanied by a loud crack and the smell of blasting powder causes the foe to stop all action. Any damage inflicted on the target will break its stupour.
You are able to cure disease.
You are able to cure disease in an area-of-effect.
Your research into lost knowledge increases your Will.
Your research into lost knowledge greatly increases your Will.
You can transfer a portion of your Power to an ally or companion.
Tier 3 Ballad: A quick ballad that gives your fellowship a bonus to their melee damage. Requires a recent Tier 2 ballad.
Anthem: Call upon a song to blast your enemies with an area-of-effect of light. Requires a recent Tier 3 ballad and resets your ballad counter.
Anthem: Call upon a song to blast your enemies with an area-of-effect of light. Requires a recent Tier 3 ballad and resets your ballad counter.
The minstrel inspires his fellows to heroic feats, opening up gated skills to most classes, and enables Lore-masters to use Beacon of Hope more frequently at a lower Morale cost.

The minstrel inspires his fellows to heroic feats, opening up gated skills to most classes, and enables Lore-masters to use Beacon of Hope more frequently at a lower Morale cost. This improved version has a longer duration and shorter recovery time.
Tier 1 Ballad: A quick ballad that gives you a bonus to Tactical attacks and harms your foe.
Brings hope to those whose Morale has been entirely depleted, reviving a defeated ally.
This skill enables you to access every Ballad Tier and Anthem at once. It also breaks any silence effects on you.
This skill soothes targets in an area who already have hate for you. This increases the likelyhood of the enemy choosing another target.
You may make a quick, sharp attack against your foe.
You are capable of posing riddles to your enemies, which may momentarily distract them, dazing them for a short time or until damaged. This will not work on Beasts, Insects, or Creatures of Nature.
Your careful aim ensures the next damage-dealing attack skill will result in a Critical Hit and has much lower chance of missing. Using this skill will not break Stealth.
You throw dust in your enemy's eyes, making it more difficult for your enemy to hit. You can only have one Trick on a target at once.
You throw dust in your enemy's eyes, making it more difficult for your enemy to hit. You can only have one Trick on a target at once.
When in Stealth, you can divert an enemy's attention away from yourself for a short time. Using this skill will not break Stealth.
You can strike a foe to slow their attacks for a short while. You can only have one Trick on a target at once.
You execute an attack that will lower your enemy's defences for a short time. You can only have one Trick on a target at once.
You can disappear from before your enemy's eyes. For a little while, your Stealth is improved, and even taking damage will not break your cover. Using this skill will not break Stealth.
You have the ability to move about unseen, though there is a chance enemies may detect you, especially when moving in front of them.
You have the ability to move about unseen, though there is a chance enemies may detect you.
You enrage your foe, causing him to flail around at any target he considers a threat. You can only have one Trick on a target at once.
When active, nearby ore deposits are displayed on the radar.
When active, nearby tree branches are displayed on the radar.
When active, nearby crops are displayed on the radar.
You auto-attack when wielding a one-handed weapon with a shield.
You auto-attack when dual-wielding one-handed weapons.
You auto-attack when wielding a two-handed weapon.
You auto-attack when wielding a bow.
You auto-attack when wielding a crossbow.
This fellowship skill does minor direct melee damage to your target, then more damage over time and can contribute to fellowship manoeuvres.
This fellowship skill does minor direct ranged damage to your target, then more damage over time and can contribute to fellowship manoeuvres.
This fellowship skill replenishes your power and can contribute to fellowship manoeuvres.
This fellowship skill does direct melee damage to your target and can contribute to fellowship manoeuvres.
This fellowship skill does direct ranged damage to your target and can contribute to fellowship manoeuvres.
This fellowship skill replenishes your morale and can contribute to fellowship manoeuvres.
You are hardier than most and can recover from being knocked down and stunned.
With a flash of steel you render your target unable to use their weapons for a short while. This skill can only be used against players.
You cut the legs of your foe, slowing their movement.
You spray your target with clinging, sticky webs, reducing their chance to Parry or Evade.
When not in combat, you can hide beneath the ground, unseen by foes, until you burst from the ground.
You carefully place a snare on the ground to trap your foes.
You release several arrows in quick succession hitting multiple foes around your target.
A fire tipped arrow which will continue to burn the target after landing.
You can shout at an ally who is stunned or knocked down and they will begin to recover.
While not in combat, you and your nearby allies can run faster.
You exhort and deride your allies, restoring some of their health.
When you defeat an enemy, you can howl to heal yourself and your fellows over time.
From beneath the very nose of your foe, you can disappear and prowl unseen once more. For a shortwhile your stealth is extremely effective.
You can prowl beneath the notice of all but the keenest eyes, waiting to strike.
You make a powerful melee attack, followed by a quick off-hand swipe.
You make a frontal area-of-effect attack.
You make a frontal area-of-effect attack.
You make a savage double attack.
You make a pair of savage attacks, followed by a quick off-hand swipe.
Your damage and Power regeneration are increased at the expense of avoidance.
You respond to some of your opponents attacks with swift counter-attacks.
You make a full area-of-effect attack.
You make a full area-of-effect attack.
You make an attack which allows you to brace yourself against counterattack, increasing your Morale by a small amount.
You make an attack which allows you to brace yourself against counterattack, increasing your Morale by a small amount.
You make a full area-of-effect attack, which can cause light damage over time.
You lose all Fervour and enter a defensive stance, which increases your parry and evade rates, but also removes fervour.
You use all of your Fervour to deal a devastating attack. This attack can only be evaded, it will never miss against on level targets, and cannot be parried or blocked.

You use all of your Fervour to deal a devastating attack and a quick off-hand swipe. The primary attack can only be evaded, it will never miss against on level targets and cannot be parried or blocked.
Your taunting cry forces your target to face and attack you for a few seconds.
You make a powerful attack that can only be used on opponents under 20% health.
You make a cunning attack that catches your opponents off-guard. Your next area-of-effect attack will cause more damage. It can only be used on opponents below 25% health.
You make a swift melee attack, which interrupts any time-delayed actions your opponent is attempting.
You make a full area-of-effect attack, which stuns your opponents.
You make an attack which snares your opponent.
You make a melee attack that dissuades your target from continuing to attack you. The target will only stop attacking you if there is another more threatening target nearby.
You attack with your ranged weapon.
Tales of your heroic acts draw cheers from the crowd.
A light, bleeding attack, which causes your foe damage over time.
You leave a Mark on your enemy that increases the amount of damage that you and your companions will deal to it. You may only mark one target at a time.
You command your Fellowship to make better speed, both in and out of battle.
You leave a Mark on your enemy, damaging your foe over time. You may only mark one target at a time.

You swing twice at your enemy, inflicting medium damage. If you land a Critical Hit on the second attack, you will be able to use your enemy defeat skills, as well as allowing you to enter into the Battle-hardened state. You must be in a Battle-readied State to use this skill.
You are able to renew one of your companions' Morale over time.
You are able to raise the Morale of your nearby companions with a motivating speech.
Your tactic is to be on guard, increasing chances of parrying attacks. No one can have more then one Tactic on at a time.
You are able to resist succumbing to defeat for a short time.
Your tactic is to attack relentlessly, increasing Critical Hit chance. No one can have more then one Tactic on at a time.
You leave a Mark on your enemy that will renew the Morale of your companions when they wound the target. You may only mark one target at a time.
When one of your companions falls, your Cry will return a nearby fellow back to battle and inspire those around you to greater feats of skill.
You put yourself in harm's way to defend your nearby companions, taking all damage dealt to them upon yourself.
Your tactic is to focus, increasing power regeneration while in combat. No one can have more then one Tactic on at a time.
Your presence commands respect from those around you.
This melee attack increases the effects of healing on yourself for a short time.
This stronger melee attack increases the effects of healing on yourself for a short time and gives Morale to your group.
Words of encouragement that renew the Morale of a companion or yourself.
Tier 1 Ballad: A quick ballad that gives you Vitality and harms your foe.
Tier 1 Ballad: This short song takes time to execute, and instead of dealing damages to your foes, it distributes the buff to your Fellowship.
Your shout does light damage to your enemies.
Your shout does light damage to your enemies. This skill now has a higher critical chance and can stun an opponent.
Tier 1 Ballad: A quick ballad that gives you an armour bonus and harms your foe.
Tier 2 Ballad: A quick ballad that gives you a bonus to your attack speed and harms your foe. Requires a recent Tier 1 ballad.
Tier 3 Ballad: A quick ballad that gives your fellowship a bonus to their resistance to fear. Requires a recent Tier 2 ballad.
Words of encouragement renew the Morale of your fellowship and increase its vigour.
Calling upon the Valar can send certain evil foes fleeing in terror for a short time.
Tier 2 Ballad: A quick ballad that gives you a bonus to your Evade and harms your foe. Requires a recent Tier 1 ballad.
Tier 2 Ballad: This short song takes time to execute, and instead of dealing damages to your foes, it distributes the buff to your Fellowship. Requires a recent Tier 1 ballad.
The next three Herald's Strikes you execute do extra damage and return part of that as Morale to your group. When you invoke this skill your reset timer of Herald's Strike is reset.
Words of encouragement renew the Morale of a companion or yourself. This maneuver is larger but slower than Raise the Spirit.
A song that makes an allies' hearts glad again, removing some of the oppression of defeat.
This song causes undead to freeze in fear.
Anthem: Increases Morale regeneration in combat for you and your Fellowship and generates less threat then direct healing. Requires a recent Tier 3 ballad and resets your ballad counter.
This aura increases the Will and Fate of your Fellowship.
Anthem: Decreases the amount of threat you generate from healing. Requires a recent Tier 3 ballad and resets your ballad counter.
Your inspirational spirit can dispel fear afflicting yourself or others.
A desperate cry instantly renews the Morale of your fellowship, but draws a large amount of attention to yourself.
Tier 3 Ballad: A quick ballad that gives your fellowship a bonus to their resistance to fire. Requires a recent Tier 2 ballad.
A song that can make your enemy become drowsy and not detect players until they are much closer than normal. This does not work against monsters already engaged in combat.
Tier 2 Ballad: A quick ballad that gives you a bonus to all your resistances and harms your foe. Requires a recent Tier 1 ballad.
You are talented at feigning death, causing enemies to ignore you completely.

This lay enables you to take damage from your Power instead of Morale when toggled. The name comes from the adage that those who know this lay were said to have been able to take a blow from Helm Hammerhand himself. Stuns and Knockdowns will interupt the lay.
Red-hot embers swirl around the target, causing damage over time and slowing movement.
Your understanding of the speech of ravens allows you to call one to assist in your adventures.
This skill makes the target more vulnerable to fire.
This channeled skill debuffs archers' damage.
This self buff protects the raven from shadow and melee attacks.
You can transfer some of your Power to Morale for both yourself and your companion. This skill only works if you have a companion summoned.
Air swirls around the target kicking up debris and other objects that causes damage and distracts nearby enemies.
Your understanding of the speech of bears allows you to call one to assist in your adventures.
Your understanding of the speech of bears allows you to call one to assist in your adventures.
This skill forces the target to attack the bear.
This skill applies an armour debuff.
This skill is a brutal attack.
You test the will of your enemy. When successful, it will damage and stun the target. This skill has a large bonus to it's critical chance and magnitude.
When your companion has flanked your enemy, the sign of Wizardry shall provide you with Morale and deals damage to your enemy. Used normally, it deals light-based damage over time.
This sign causes your enemy to pause so it attacks slower and parries less often.

This sign will cure silence, knockdown, and knock-out effects, and then will provide temporary immunity to knockdown and knock-out effects. Used preventively, it will make you immune to these effects for a period of time.

This sign will cure silence, knockdown, and knock-out effects, and then will provide temporary immunity to knockdown and knock-out effects. Used preventively, it will make you immune to these effects for a period of time.
This sign provides you with a heightened vigilance against those who would hide from your gaze.
This sign provides you with a heightened vigilance against those who would hide from your gaze.
Your knowledge of things natural gives you influence over the very environment itself. You are able to subtly raise the temperature, making it difficult for most creatures to deal damage to you.
Your knowledge of things natural gives you influence over the air itself, allowing you to slow many of your enemies at once.
Your knowledge of things natural gives you influence over the ground and plants, allowing you to root a group of enemies in place.
You call upon the wisdom of the Valar, recovering some of your skills.
Your wisdom can light even the darkest of places, harming and stunning those that are in opposition to your purpose.
Large sweeping strokes cut into all of your foes standing before you.
You focus your defences on blocking attacks.
You are skilled at swiftly retaliating after parrying an enemy's attack.
After a successful Shield-swipe, you may bash him again with your shield, stunning him briefly. This skill draws the enemy's attention to yourself.
You are able to make a powerful attack against an enemy who has suffered your Retaliation. This attack will stun the target on a critical hit.
You focus your defences on parrying attacks.
After successfully retaliating, you may make a whirling attack against all enemies in a circle around you.
Follow-up your Retaliation with a thrusting blow, which will open a bleeding wound.
Laugh at your enemies after bashing them with your Shield-swipe, taunting them. This skill draws the enemy's attention to yourself.
Your attack enables you to break your enemy's concentration, interrupting his actions.
When dazed, stunned, knocked down, or knocked out you may turn the tables on your enemy, recovering from the effects and instilling them in your enemy.
You can create a whistle out of an acorn that will allow your fellows to call you to them when they are in need.
You can knock an enemy down, opening up an opportunity to use Fellowship skills if you are in a Fellowship. Only useable while in Stealth.
You can knock an enemy down, opening up an opportunity to use Fellowship skills if you are in a Fellowship. Only useable while in Stealth, but it does not break your Stealth.
You are skilled at surprising your enemy in battle, inflicting more damage when attacking from behind or while in Stealth. Critical hits with Surprise Strike are more damaging than most skills.
You are skilled at surprising your enemy in battle, inflicting more damage when attacking from behind or while in Stealth. Critical hits with Surprise Strike are more damaging than most skills.
Your formidable cunning allows a darting attack which continues to deal damage after you strike, dealing even more damage if the attack is made while in Stealth.
Your formidable cunning allows a darting attack which continues to deal damage after you strike, dealing even more damage if the attack is made while in Stealth.
You can cause your enemy to focus his aggression on his current opponent, whether that is yourself or an ally.
You can cause your enemy to focus his aggression on his current opponent, whether that is yourself or an ally.
You are able to make another attack after a Critical Hit, inflicting more damage when attacking from behind.
After using your Burglar's Advantage, you can make two attacks against your target.
You are able to stun your target, creating an opportunity to use Fellowship skills if you are in a Fellowship.
You confuse your enemy so thoroughly that he fails any skill attempts in process, and any subsequent skill attempts for a short time take much longer to execute.
You startle an enemy with an active Trick on them, stunning them for 8s and removing the Trick.
You can surprise a foe with an active Trick on them, removing the Trick and restoring some of your Morale. This will never miss against on level targets, nor can it be parried, blocked, or evaded.
While you maintain this ability, you are able to point out weaknesses in your enemy's defences, increasing the damage taken from attacks. Using this skill will not break Stealth.
While you maintain this ability, you are able to point out weaknesses in your enemy's defences, increasing the damage taken from attacks. Using this skill will not break Stealth.
You are ready for action again, resetting the recovery timers on many of your skills. Using this skill will not break Stealth.
You can improve your ability to evade your enemy's attacks for a short time. Using this skill will not break Stealth.
When dazed, stunned, knocked down, or knocked out you may quickly recover, gaining Morale and a temporary improvement to your evasion. Using this skill will not break Stealth.
Turns on tracking for treasure chests and other value-laden containers.
While sneaking about, you can attempt to lighten the pockets of unsuspecting targets.
Your resourcefulness allows you to purge poisons ailing an ally.
You can nock and loose an arrow quickly.
You can nock and loose an arrow quickly. Your knowledge of Elvish or dwarf-virtues allows your arrows to inflict light damage.
You can nock and loose an arrow quickly. You set your oil-soaked arrows alight, inflicting fire damage.
Your arrow can cause a wound that bleeds and slightly slows movement speed.
Through your knowledge of Elvish or dwarf-virtues, your arrow causes light damage over time and slightly slows movement speed.
Your oil-soaked arrow sets your enemy aflame and causes it to burn and slightly slows movement speed.
You are able to loose two missiles in rapid succession.
You are able to loose two missiles in rapid succession. Your knowledge of Elvish or dwarf-virtues allows your arrows to inflict light damage.
You are able to loose two missiles in rapid succession. You set your oil-soaked arrows alight, inflicting fire damage.
An extremely damaging shot that pierces the armour of your enemy, ignoring 10% mitigation.
An extremely damaging shot that pierces the armour of your enemy, ignoring 10% mitigation. Your knowledge of Elvish or dwarf-virtues allows your arrows to inflict light damage.
An extremely damaging shot that pierces the armour of your enemy, ignoring 10% mitigation. You set your oil-soaked arrows alight, inflicting fire damage.
You rain arrows down upon your enemies, allowing you to hit multiple targets.
You rain arrows down upon your enemies, allowing you to hit multiple targets. Your knowledge of Elvish or dwarf-virtues allows your arrows to inflict light damage.
You rain arrows down upon your enemies, allowing you to hit multiple targets. You set your oil-soaked arrows alight, inflicting fire damage.
When your enemy falls below 25% of its health, you may make a shot which inflicts massive damage. If you land a Critical Hit, this attack will deal exceptional bonus damage.
You can make a low cut in front of you which can temporarily slow the movement speed of up to 2 of your enemies.
You can make a low cut in front of you which can temporarily slow the movement speed of up to 3 of your enemies.
This attack wounds your foe, dealing additional damage if the enemy is suffering from your Barbed Arrow. However, using this skill will stop the bleeding.
This attack wounds your foe, dealing additional damage if the enemy is suffering from your Barbed Arrow. However, using this skill will stop the bleeding.
You are able to divert your enemy's attention with a single melee strike and follow it with a single bow-attack at close range.
When you parry an enemy's attack, you can respond with a highly damaging melee attack.
When you parry an enemy's attack, you can respond with a highly damaging melee attack.
Your skill as a tracker allows you to increase the speed with which your Fellowship can move across terrain. Entering combat disables this ability.
Your survival-lore allows you to use naturally-occurring medicines to purge poisons from an ally.
Your survival-skills enable you to make your Fellowship comfortable in the wild, increasing their recovery and enabling some crafting skills. The campfire lasts for 3 minutes.
Your knowledge of the land and of its many secret ways allows you to escape from danger and travel to a nearby rally point. Requires rations which may be acquired from Provisioners.
Your skill as a tracker allows you to find a path for you and your Fellowship to Thorin's Halls. This skill is easily interrupted. Requires rations which may be acquired from Provisioners.
Your skill as a tracker allows you to find a path for you and your Fellowship to Bree. This skill is easily interrupted. Requires rations which may be acquired from Provisioners.
Your skill as a tracker allows you to find a path for you and your Fellowship to Esteldin. This skill is easily interrupted. Requires rations which may be acquired from Provisioners.
Your skill as a tracker allows you to find a path for you and your Fellowship to Rivendell. This skill is easily interrupted. Requires rations which may be acquired from Provisioners.
Your skill as a tracker allows you to detect the presence of nearby beasts and other natural creatures.
Your skill as a tracker allows you to detect the presence of nearby orcs, trolls, giants, and evil men or dwarves.
Your skill as a tracker allows you to detect the presence of the dead, the unseen, and ancient evil.
You have the ability to blend into your surroundings, making it difficult for your foes to detect you so long as you remain still.
You mimic the cry of a predatory animal, causing an enemy beast to run in fear.
Before combat, you may rapidly increase your Focus. Focus is required to use some bow skills and is lost if you move.
You take a stance which decreases the possibility that your enemies will avoid your shots. While in Precision Stance, your Quick Shot has an increased chance to score Critical Hits.

You take a stance which increases the damage of your shots, while increasing the Power cost and draws the enemy's attention to yourself. While in Strength Stance, your Quick Shot will slow your enemy's movement.

You take a stance which decreases the Power cost and reduces the chance that your enemy's attention will turn to you. While in Endurance Stance, your Quick Shot does not draw as much attention as it normally does.

You take a stance which decreases the Power cost and reduces the chance that your enemy's attention will turn to you. While in Endurance Stance, your Quick Shot does not draw as much attention as it normally does.
This grants you a short ranged attack.
Your skill as a hobbit allows you to find a path back to The Shire. This skill is easily interrupted.
You can raise your Fellowship's Hope value through good old-fashioned hobbit-cheer. This does not stack with other Hope buffs.
Although untrained, you have the natural ability to move about unseen, though there is a chance enemies may detect you, especially when moving in front of them.
You can lie prone in complete silence, causing enemies to ignore you.
You make a stiff punch at your enemy.
This enables you to quickly return to Bree. This skill is easily interrupted.
You provide a bonus to your Fellowship's Morale.
In combat, the Race of Man is known for its unquenchable spirit. This skill restores lost morale.
Although untrained, you have the natural ability to move about unseen, though there is a chance enemies may detect you, especially when moving in front of them.
This enables you to quickly return to Rivendell. This skill is easily interrupted.
With the speed and grace of the Eldar, you can put up a strong parry defence.
You provide a bonus to your Fellowship's Power.
Allows you to smash an enemy with your head for damage.
This enables you to quickly return to Thorin's Gate. This skill is easily interrupted.
For a short amount of time, you can withstand blows that would batter a weaker race's Morale into dust.
You provide a bonus to your Fellowship's Vitality.
Two fast attacks on your target.
A sweeping cut that can damage multiple targets in front of you.
A destructive attack, weakening the target's armour.
When your target has less than half of their morale, you can make an extremely damaging attack with an increased chance to critical. This skill will consume all your remaining power.
You throw dust into the air around, blinding nearby foes.
The sight of your opponents falling before you catapults you into an empowering rage, giving you burst of healing and increasing damage dealt and taken.
You pull on your bow and loose an arrow.
You loose several arrows, carved and crafted to howl as they fly through the air, dealing shadow damage.
A sharpened arrow that can pierce armour.
A shaft aimed to slow the movement of your quarry.
A sweeping cut that can damage multiple targets in front of you.
You can better evade the attacks of your foes for a short period of time.
Auto-attack when wielding only a single one-handed weapon.
A ferocious and terrifying battle roar to weaken the certainty and morale of your foe.
You swing your weapon at your foe.
Your blistering derision shames your target to higher health.
You bellow a harsh command, enabling up to 5 nearby and defeated allies to rise, albeit at very low health.
You single out an ally to support and protect them in the midst of battle.
When the fight has begun, your commanding aura allows your allies to fight more viciously.
Auto-attack when wielding a one-handed weapon with a shield.
An attack with your sharp talons deals damage and causes the target to bleed.
A ranged attack which flings a painful contact poison at the target causing damage over time.
A bite injecting a poison which weakens the target and can stun them if not cured.
A ranged attack that targets the victim's legs with sticky webs, rooting them in place.
You can cover your target's arms with sticky webbing, slowing their attacks.
You can spit a crippling poison in a spray, hitting enemies in front of you up to a short distance away. This skill is only effective against players.
You can burrow into the ground becoming invulnerable and hidden for a limited time.
You attack with your sharp and piercing claws.
With the element of surprise, your clawing attack is even more damaging.
You leap at your target to distract them, interrupting actions they were performing. If the target was suffering from your crippling bite he is knocked down.
Unseen till the last moment, you leap at your target and knock them down to the ground.
You rip at your target's flesh, tearing muscle and slowing his attacks. If the target was suffering from your crippling bite he begins taking damage over time.
A sharp snap of your jaws and your target's movement is slowed.
You sink your teeth and rip, your target is silenced.
A sudden burst of speed for catching prey, or to avoid becoming it.
Auto-attack when not wielding a weapon in the primary hand.
Auto-attack when wielding only a single one-handed weapon.
A short song of courage removes fear effects and grants fear immunity to your entire Fellowship, as well as acting as a powerful heal over time.
Your banner rallies the morale of your nearby companions.
Your banner increases the power regeneration your nearby companions.
Your banner inspires your nearby companions to greater feats of skill and strength.
Empowered air swirls around your target, inflicting damage on any who strike it. This skill cannot be used on yourself.
An attack that makes up for a lack of elegance with brutal effectiveness.
A sweeping cut that can damage multiple targets in front of the attacker.
A basic, but effective cutting attack.
Two quick attacks on your target.
Your heroic actions inspire your fellows restoring their power, while sapping yours. This skill can only be played after defeating an enemy.
Increases your parry rate. This skill can only be played after defeating an enemy.
Your threat generation and Power regeneration are increased at the expense of damage output.
Adds a fervour pip when cast, and an additional fervour pip every 15 seconds. This skill can only be played after defeating an enemy.
Auto-attack when attacking with single unarmed attacks.
This skill takes threat away from the Champion and gives it to a fellowship member.
This skill takes threat away from a fellowship member and gives it to the Champion.
This melee attack raises the Morale of your Shield-brother.
This toggle marks one of your fellows as your Shield-brother, making them the target of some of your abilities.
Auto-attack when wielding only a single one-handed weapon.
A scattered people, the Rangers of the North are skilled at becoming unseen when they wish it.
Although not capable of being invisible in the spirit world, Rangers are still known for disappearing from sight. For a short while your stealth is extremely effective.
A ranger is both master of blade and bow. This attack will knock down the opponent.
Strength of morale can be called from the line of Elros even still in this dark time. This will restore morale to the Ranger.
When marked as a prey of one of the DÃºnedain, their wrath is terrible. This skill is the prerequisite of Fly True.

This shot can only be used against those that bear the Dunedain Mark, but once marked, the enemy takes devastating damage. This skill can only be used from stealth. It will never miss against on-level creatures. On a critical the target will take power damage as well.
Your skill as a tracker allows you to find a path for you and your Fellowship to West Angmar. This skill is easily interrupted. Requires rations which may be acquired from Provisioners.
Your skill as a tracker allows you to find a path for you and your Fellowship to East Angmar. This skill is easily interrupted. Requires rations which may be acquired from Provisioners.

You can bind yourself to one of many camp sites scattered across the world. Then you can use your knowledge of the land to travel with your fellowship back to your current camp site. Requires rations which may be acquired from Provisioners.

Your skill as a tracker allows you to find a path for you and your Fellowship to Ost Guruth in the Lonelands. This skill is easily interrupted. Requires rations which may be acquired from Provisioners.

Your skill as a tracker allows you to find a path for you and your Fellowship to Michel Delving in the Shire. This skill is easily interrupted. Requires rations which may be acquired from Provisioners.
Your skill as a tracker allows you to find a path for you and your Fellowship to Evendim. This skill is easily interrupted. Requires rations which may be acquired from Provisioners.
This well thrown knife will root an in-bound target.
These arrows will make the servant of the Eye burn.
Taking great care and practiced aim, you prepare a shot to strike at your target's most vital weak spot. This shot will not miss, nor can your target parry, block, or evade it.
You find strength in the land; devoting all your attention you can recover power swiftly in the midst of conflict. This skill is easily interrupted.
Crush little annoying things. Sometimes, stun them. Sometimes, make them hurt long time.
Swat the whiny little things so they fly away. Sometimes, they run slow after.
Throw rock at far away things. Hurt things near far thing. Sometimes, make things bleed after.
Quick-ish stone from the ground attack
Hit small things twice. Sometimes, make things hit back slow.
Bring foot up, put foot down, puny things fall over. Sometimes, things get hurt easier after.
Pick up rock. Drop rock. Sometimes, hurt little things extra lots.
Get angry. Hit harder. Hit faster. Not move so fast.
Roar of rage. When is sometimes? Sometimes is next.
This skill draws the attention of nearby monsters to the Hunter's Lure trap.

Your wilderness knowledge allows you to prepare a snare for enemies which will slow them and cause them damage over time. The trap remains for 60 seconds after being placed. This skill is easily interrupted.
You temporarily increase the offensive strength of your Shield-brother.
You make a melee attack that interrupts any time-delayed actions your opponent is attempting.
You inflict a blow that calls attention to yourself in battle. When dealt to a foe bleeding from your Cutting Attack, your perceived threat is also raised.
A well ordered withdrawal can aid the Captain in living through a harsh battle. This skill lowers your threat to your opponents around you.
You sacrifice some of your morale to gain the same effect as defeating an enemy and to put yourself in a Battle-readied State.
This powerful melee attack has an increased chance to critical and inspires your fellows to invoke the Light of Elendil. This skill can only be executed when you are in a Battle-hardened State.
You are able to revive and protect a fallen companion with three quarters of their Morale and half of their Power.
You enlist a Herald to carry your Banner of Victory into battle. This banner increases the maximum Power and in-combat Power regeneration of those around it.
You enlist a Herald to carry your Banner of War into battle. This banner increases the Might and Agility of those around it.
You enlist a Herald to carry your Banner of Hope into battle. This banner increases the maximum Morale and in-combat Morale regeneration of those around it.
When active, nearby artifacts are displayed on the radar.
A burst of speed can make the difference between freedom and flattened.
Sometimes survival comes down to not being hit. Actually, most times.
Nothing can escape your searching gaze. So long as it is a worm.
Auto-attack when attacking with single unarmed attacks.
Your reassuring presence increases the amount of Morale your Shield-brother recovers.
Middle-Earth is a dangerous place. Sometimes it is good to be dead.
This warband skill does direct melee damage to your target and can contribute to warband manoeuvres.
You're not sure what, but something isn't right.
The Lore-master heaves a glowing orb into the sky that detonates into an explosion of fireworks. Up to three of the dead will then be stunned for 5 seconds and then mezzed for 10 seconds.

Your knowledge of warding lore, enables you to create an area that is the bane of the chosen creature, creating a sanctified area where they will take more damage from tactical skills and have an increased miss chance. This lasts for one minute.

Your knowledge of warding lore, enables you to create an area that is the bane of the chosen creature, creating a sanctified area where they will take more damage from tactical skills and have an increased miss chance. This lasts for one minute.

Your knowledge of warding lore, enables you to create an area that is the bane of the chosen creature, creating a sanctified area where they will take more damage from tactical skills and have an increased miss chance. This lasts for one minute.

This allows the Lore-master to prepare a concoction of magnetized metal fillings and other obscure materials. This makes wearing armor more difficult and heavily armored creatures irritated thereby rendering their armor ineffective.
War-speech must be active to use this skill. You invoke the name of the Elder King, chief of the Valar, blasting a group of your foes and reducing their resistance to further attacks.
You call out to a fellow, inspiring him to greatness.
You call out to your fellows, encouraging them to greater effectiveness during Fellowship Manoeuvres.
War-speech must be active to use this skill. Your rousing tales of the Second Age dishearten nearby foes and lighten the footsteps of your allies.
You have mastered Lay of the Hammerhand well enough to bestow a lesser benefit upon an ally.
This chant summons an Oathbreaker Blade to harry your foe. When in War-speech, this chant is upgraded to Chorus of the Oathbreakers.
This aura increases the Vitality and Wound Resistance of your Fellowship.
This aura increases the Hope and Armour of your Fellowship.
Your charismatic speech drives fear into the hearts of your enemies.

The Lore-master smashes a vial of foul smelling sticky tar onto the ground causing an area that is 50% harder to move through, as well as making enemy creatures 10% more vulnerable to fire. This area lasts for one minute.
The Lore-master can smash his staff upon the ground, causing a thunderclap stunning creatures around him for 3 seconds and causing weak damage.
This howl summons a pair of Oathbreaker Blades to harry your foe.

The Lore-master summons a storm which attracts electrical energy to targets that have already been coated with the mixture of materials from Ancient Craft. This bond of nature is difficult for the mortal races and is very demanding on the Lore-master's morale.
This warband skill does direct ranged damage to your target, then transfers morale to you from your target and can contribute to warband manoeuvres.
This warband skill does direct melee damage to your target, then morale over time and can contribute to warband manoeuvres.
This warband skill does direct melee damage to your target, then transfers power to you from your target and can contribute to warband manoeuvres.
This warband skill does direct ranged damage to your target, then transfers power to you from your target and can contribute to warband manoeuvres.
This warband skill does direct ranged damage to your target, then morale over time and can contribute to warband manoeuvres.
This warband skill does direct ranged damage to your target and can contribute to warband manoeuvres.
Your understanding of the speech of lynx allows you to call one to assist in your adventures.
You strike a quick but potent chord, instantly recovering an ally's Morale.
You perform a melody so irresistable that all Free Peoples who hear it cannot help but dance.
This will scribe a manual to teach others to play the harp. Doing so is much more taxing then training in person and requires a Blank Mentor Manual.

When you enter Scribe Stance, you change your Mentor skills into Scribe Manual skills, allowing you to create manuals to teach instruments. Scribing manuals is much more taxing then teaching in person, requires a Blank Mentor Manual, and will apply a 10 day cooldown to all Mentor skills.
This will scribe a manual to teach others to play the cowbell. Doing so is much more taxing then training in person and requires a Blank Mentor Manual.
This will scribe a manual to teach others to play the drum. Doing so is much more taxing then training in person and requires a Blank Mentor Manual.
This will scribe a manual to teach others to play the flute. Doing so is much more taxing then training in person and requires a Blank Mentor Manual.
This will scribe a manual to teach others to play the horn. Doing so is much more taxing then training in person and requires a Blank Mentor Manual.
This will scribe a manual to teach others to play Moor cowbell. Doing so is much more taxing then training in person and requires a Blank Mentor Manual.
This will scribe a manual to teach others to play the theorbo. Doing so is much more taxing then training in person and requires a Blank Mentor Manual.
This will scribe a manual to teach others to play the bagpipes. Doing so is much more taxing then training in person and requires a Blank Mentor Manual.
This will scribe a manual to teach others to play the clarinet. Doing so is much more taxing then training in person and requires a Blank Mentor Manual.
A massive attack that works only from stealth. This skill has a high chance scoring a critical attack. When attacking from behind this attack delivers more damage.
An eye gouge and slash. This skill works in a 60 degree front arc.
The agile lynx darts from enemy to enemy slashing them with its claws in a forward 180 arc.
Your understanding of the speech of bird allows you to call one to make the dark times a little brighter.
Your understanding of the speech of cat allows you to call one to make the dark times a little brighter.
Your understanding of the speech of dog allows you to call one to make the dark times a little brighter.
Your understanding of the speech of fox allows you to call one to make the dark times a little brighter.
Your understanding of the speech of frog allows you to call one to make the dark times a little brighter.
Your understanding of the speech of rabbit allows you to call one to make the dark times a little brighter.
Your understanding of the speech of snake allows you to call one to make the dark times a little brighter.
Your understanding of the speech of cat allows you to call one to make the dark times a little brighter.
Your understanding of the speech of turtle allows you to call one to make the dark times a little brighter.
With some careful thought, the Lore-master can restore a fallen comrade to fighting trim, reviving a defeated ally at a small cost of fragrant herbs.
Your teeth bite deeply of your foe, tearing a tendon and opening a chance for a warband manoeuver.
A swift swipe meant for the eyes breaks your opponent's concentration.
When the time comes to enter the fray it falls to the orcs to break battle lines. You gain a short immunity to root, stun and daze effects. Your speed increases for a brief period of time.
When your target begins preparing an attack, you give them a swift punch to the gut to interrupt their preparation.
Your knowledge of the enemy is so great that you can target vital organs with great efficacy.
Your sight is so keen that you can keep a close eye on an enemy and never lose sight of them.
Seeing a ranged opponent preparing an assault, you take careful aim and disrupt their attempts.
A terrible banner strikes fear into your enemies and weakens their resolve.
You spew soul words in the forgotten and vile language of LugbÃ»rz. The conviction and terror inherent in this speech weakens the heart of your enemy.
You place a banner bearing the symbol of the mightiest orc tribe, the Krahjarn. All who stand near the banner draw strength from the symbol.
Your webs can be used to create sticky areas on the ground that slow the movement of any enemy who dares cross them.
Focusing all your energy on a single target you are able to overwhelm them beneath the weight of your webs opening the possibility of a fellowship manoeuver.
A ranged attack delivering a small amount of damage and a host of eggs that could hatch!
This skill enables you to examine the weaknesses and strengths of certain creatures.
You can instruct someone how to play the harp.
You can instruct someone how to play the bagpipes.
You can instruct someone how to play the clarinet.
You can instruct someone how to play the cowbell.
You can instruct someone how to play the horn.
You can instruct someone how to play Moor cowbell.
You can instruct someone how to play the theorbo.
You can instruct someone how to play the drum.
You can instruct someone how to play the flute.
Return quickly to your personal home. This skill is easily interrupted.
Return quickly to your kinship's house. This skill is easily interrupted.
This skill will cause the Eagle to break the induction of a target, they are fighting.
